Package Model

Class Bullet

java.lang.Object
Model.GameObject
Model.Bullet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Bullet
extends GameObject
This class is for the bullets which Dante's gun shoots. It renders the graphics of the bullet and sets the collision with enemies.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Bullet

      public Bullet​(int x, int y, ID id, int mx, int my, int range, int damage, java.awt.image.BufferedImage shotType, double speed)
      This is the constructor to create an instance of Bullet
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate where the bullet should start
      y - y-coordinate where the bullet should start
      id - ID for this class
      mx - x-coordinate of the bullet's last position
      my - y-coordinate of the bullet's last position
      range - maximal distance the bullet can go to
      damage - how much damage the bullet does to enemies
      shotType - what image should be displayed for this bullet
      speed - the firespeed of the bullet

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Checks for every period of time if the bullet collides with an object. If it intersects with the hitbox of an enemy the bullet will disappear and the enemy will receive damage. If the bullet collides with a door or a block the bullet will just disappear. The bullet will also disappear if it has reached its range.
      Specified by:
      tick in class GameObject

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Renders the hitbox and the bullet image.
      Specified by:
      render in class GameObject
      Parameters:
      g - graphics where everything should be drawn on

    • getBounds

      public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the bounds of the bullet object
      Specified by:
      getBounds in class GameObject
      Returns:
      bounds in form of a rectangle
